abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Southwest Coast Environmental Project, which improves
            delivery of basic urban services. It discusses negative
            environmental impacts and measures to mitigate them. These
            measures include scheduling construction work around the
            tourist season; using acoustic screens and ear protectors;
            undertaking aesthetic improvements and landscaping at
            visible sites as well as designating a buffer zone around
            the facilities; liaising with local residents to minimize
            disruption during construction; storing chemicals and fuels
            in sealed, bunded areas to prevent spills; minimizing tree
            felling and agricultural land loss; implementing dust
            control measures like water spraying, restricting earth
            moving during windy conditions, and covering soil
            stockpiles; providing litter fencing and vermin control at
            the sanitary landfill; restricting construction and waste
            transfer traffic to suitable routes and normal working
            hours; providing, operating, and maintaining effective
            leachate and landfill gas control systems to prevent fires;
            and ventilating to keep the chamber walls dry and to prevent
            the formation of sulfuric acid-forming bacteria. Also, given
            the importance of tourism and associated bathing and
            water-based recreation in the area, routine water quality
            monitoring is needed.
